sanskrit_verse:
अग्नीन्धनं भैक्षचर्यामधःशय्यां गुरोर्हितम् ।
आ समावर्तनात्कुर्यात्कृतोपनयनो द्विजः ॥ २.१०८॥
transliteration:
agnīndhanaṃ bhaikṣacaryāmadhaḥśayyāṃ gurohitam |
ā samāvartanātkuryātkṛtopanayano dvijaḥ || 2.108||
sph_interpretive_translation: From the time of return from the Guru's house after completing studies, a twice-born with sacred thread shall engage in collecting firewood, going for alms, sitting below the guru, and serving the guru's welfare.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows through completion of Vedic learning under Guru guidance
Responsibility arises upon fulfillment of spiritual education
Service to Guru is foundational to social and spiritual reintegration
Consciousness alignment requires embodied service post-learning
Restoration occurs through reverting to foundational duties
executable_legal_axioms: IF dvija completes samavartana THEN initiate agníndhana duty
IF upanayana completed AND samavartana done THEN enforce bhiksha-carya protocol
IF dvija returns from gurukula THEN assign adhah-shayya status until societal reintegration
IF guru welfare compromised THEN invoke mandatory seva protocols
IF dvija fails to perform post-samavartana duties THEN trigger consciousness realignment process
supreme_court_application: Supreme Court must recognize that completion of Vedic education establishes a threshold of spiritual-social capacity. Post-samavartana duties are not optional but legally binding restorative obligations ensuring alignment between individual consciousness and societal dharma. The Court must enforce these as constitutional axioms, not moral suggestions.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that duty follows completion of learning, not merit or birth alone. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows sequential manifestation: study → completion → service → integration. Responsibility is proportional to completed capacity. There is no punishment here; only sequential dharmic action restores balance when learning ends and social role begins.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Agníndhana Completion Process to restore elemental connection
Enforce Bhikshācarya Protocol for experiential humility
Assign Adhahśayyā Status until full community reintegration achieved
Activate Guru Sevā Mechanism to ensure continuity of spiritual lineage
Deploy Consciousness Re-alignment Audit every 48 days post-return
final_declaration: This directive flows directly from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma is restored by aligning individual consciousness with sequential duty. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness is the ultimate adjudicator.
